The humanities are academic disciplines that study human culture , using methods that are primarily analytical , critical , or speculative , and having a significant historical element , as distinguished from the mainly empirical approaches of the natural sciences .
The humanities include  प्राचीन  and modern languages , literature , philosophy , religion , and visual and performing arts such as music and theatre .
The humanities that are also regarded as social sciences include history , anthropology , area studies , communication studies , cultural studies , law , economics and linguistics .
Scholars  working  in the humanities are sometimes described as `` humanists '' .
However ,  कि  term also  describes  the philosophical position of humanism , which some `` antihumanist `` scholars in the humanities reject .
Some secondary schools offer humanities classes , usually  consisting  of  अंग्रेज़ी  literature , global studies , and art .
Human disciplines like history  ,  cultural anthropology and psychoanalysis study subject matters to which  the  experimental method does not apply  ,  and they have access instead to the comparative method  और  comparative  शोध   .
the  2005 Blue Room Christmas Tree
The White  हाउस  Christmas Tree , also known as the Blue Room Christmas Tree , is the official indoor  क्रिसमस   पेड़  at the residence of the President of the United States , the White House  .
The first indoor Christmas tree was installed in the White House sometime in the 19th  सदी  ( there are varying claims as to the exact year ) and since 1961 the tree has had a  प्रसंग   मोटिफ  at the discretion of the First  महिला  of the United States .
The President of the United States of America ( POTUS  )  is the head of state and head of government of the United  राज्य  .
The president leads the executive branch of  the  federal government and is the commander-in-chief of the United States Armed Forces .
Article II of the U.S. Constitution vests the executive power of the United States in the president and charges him with the execution of federal law , alongside the responsibility  of  appointing federal executive , diplomatic , regulatory , and judicial officers , and concluding treaties  साथ   विदेशी  powers , with the advice and consent of the Senate .
The president is further empowered to grant federal pardons and  reprieves  , and to convene and adjourn either or both houses of Congress  अंतर्गत  extraordinary circumstances .
Since  the  founding of the United States , the power of the president and the federal government have grown substantially and each modern president , despite possessing no formal legislative powers beyond signing or vetoing congressionally passed  बिल्स  , is  largely  responsible for dictating the legislative agenda  of  his party and the  विदेशी  and domestic policy  of  the United States .
The president is  अक्सर  described as the most  शक्तिशाली  person in the world .
The president is indirectly elected by  the  people  through  the Electoral College to  a  four-year term , and is one of only two nationally elected federal officers , the other being the Vice President of the United States  .
The Twenty-second Amendment , adopted in 1951 , prohibits anyone from ever being elected to  the  presidency for a third full term .
It also prohibits a person from being  निर्वाचित  to the presidency more  than  once if that person  previously   था  served  as  president , or acting president , for  अधिक  than  दो  years of another  व्यक्ति   's  term as president .
In all , 43  individuals  have served 55 four-year terms .
On January 20 ,  2009  , Barack Obama became the 44th and current president .
on  November 6 ,  2012  , he was re-elected and is scheduled  to  serve until January 20  ,  2017 .
Senses are physiological capacities of organisms that provide  आंकड़ा  for perception .
The senses and their operation , classification , and theory are overlapping topics studied  by  a variety of fields , most notably neuroscience , cognitive psychology ( or cognitive science  )  , and philosophy of perception .
the  nervous system has a specific sensory system or organ ,  समर्पित  to each sense .
Humans have a multitude of  होश  .
Sight ( ophthalmoception ) , hearing ( audioception ) , taste (  gustaoception  ) , smell (  olfacoception  or olfacception ) ,  और  touch ( tactioception ) are the five traditionally recognized .
While the ability  to  detect other stimuli beyond those governed  by  the  परंपरागत  senses exists  ,  including temperature  (  thermoception ) , kinesthetic sense ( proprioception ) ,  पीड़ा  ( nociception ) , balance ( equilibrioception ) , acceleration ( kinesthesioception ) , and  विभिन्न  internal stimuli ( e.g .  the  different chemoreceptors for detecting salt and  कार्बन  dioxide concentrations in the blood ) , only  a  small number of these can safely be classified  as   पृथक  senses in and of themselves .
What constitutes a sense is  a  matter of some debate , leading to difficulties in defining  कया  exactly a  भाव   is  .
Animals also have receptors to sense the world around them  ,  with  डिग्री  of capability varying greatly between species .
Humans have a  comparatively  weak sense of smell , while some animals may lack one or more of the traditional five senses .
Some animals may  भी  intake  और   interpret   संवेदी  stimuli in very different  तरीके  .
Some  प्रजाति  of animals are able to sense the world in a way that humans can not , with some species able to sense electrical and magnetic fields  ,  and detect water pressure and currents .
Spiders ( order Araneae ) are air-breathing arthropods that have eight legs and chelicerae with fangs that  इंजेक्ट  venom .
They are the largest order of arachnids and rank seventh in total species diversity among all other groups  of  organisms .
Spiders are found  विश्वव्यापी  on every continent except for Antarctica , and have become established  in  nearly every habitat with the  एक्सेप्शन  of air and sea  colonization  .
As of 2008 ,  at  least 43,678 spider species , and 109 families have been recorded by taxonomists ; however , there has been confusion within the  वैज्ञानिक  community as to how all these families should be classified , as evidenced by the over 20 different  classifications  that have been proposed since 1900 .
Anatomically , spiders differ from other arthropods in that the usual body segments are fused into two tagmata , the cephalothorax and abdomen , and joined by a small , cylindrical pedicel .
Unlike insects  ,  spiders do not have antennae .
In all except the most primitive group , the  mesothelae  , spiders have the most  centralized  nervous systems of  सब  arthropods , as all  उनके  ganglia are fused into one mass in the  cephalothorax  .
Unlike most arthropods , spiders have no extensor muscles in  उनके   limbs  and instead extend  उन्हें  by hydraulic pressure .
Their abdomens bear appendages that have been modified into spinnerets that  extrude  silk from up to six types of silk  ग्रंथियों  within their abdomen .
मकड़ी  webs vary widely in size ,  आकार   और  the amount of sticky thread used .
It now appears that the spiral orb web may  be  one of the  earliest  forms , and spiders that  उपज  tangled cobwebs  हैं   अधिक  abundant and diverse than  orb-web   मकड़ियों  .
Spider-like arachnids with silk-producing spigots appeared in the Devonian period about , but these animals apparently lacked spinnerets .
True spiders have been found in Carboniferous rocks from ,  और  are very  समान  to the most primitive surviving order , the Mesothelae  .
The main groups of modern spiders , Mygalomorphae and Araneomorphae , first appeared in the Triassic period , before  .
A herbivorous species , Bagheera kiplingi , was described in 2008 , but all other known species  हैं   परभक्षी  ,  ज़्यादातर  preying on insects and on other spiders , although a few large species also take birds and lizards .
मकड़ियों  use  a  wide range of strategies to capture prey : trapping it in sticky webs , lassoing it with sticky  bolas  , mimicking the prey  to  avoid  डिटेक्शन   ,  or running it down .
Most detect prey mainly by sensing vibrations , but the active  hunters  have acute  दृष्टि  , and hunters of the genus Portia show signs of intelligence in  उनके  choice of tactics and ability  to  develop new ones  .
Spiders '  गुस्ताखी  are too narrow to take solids , and they liquidize their food by  बाढ़  it with digestive enzymes  और  grinding it with  the  bases of their pedipalps , as they do not have true jaws .
Male spiders identify themselves  by  a variety of complex courtship rituals to avoid being  खाया  by the females .
Males of most species survive a few matings  ,  limited mainly by their short life spans .
Females weave silk egg-cases , each of which may contain hundreds of eggs .
Females of many species care for their young ,  लिये   उदाहरण  by carrying them around or by sharing food with  उन्हें  .
A minority  of  species are  सोशल  , building communal  webs  that may  हाउस  anywhere from a few to 50,000 individuals .
Social behavior ranges from precarious toleration ,  as  in the widow spiders , to co-operative hunting and  food-sharing   .
Although most spiders  सजीव  for at most two years , tarantulas and other mygalomorph spiders can live up to 25 years in captivity  .
While the  venom  of a few species is dangerous to humans , scientists are now  researching  the use of spider venom in medicine and as  non-polluting   pesticides  .
Spider silk provides a combination of lightness , strength and elasticity that is superior to that of synthetic materials , and spider  रेशा  genes have  महरूम  inserted into  स्तनधारियों   और  plants to see if these can be used as silk factories .
As a result of their wide range of behaviors , spiders have become common  प्रतीकों  in art and mythology symbolizing various combinations of patience , cruelty and creative powers .
धूसर  's  anatomy  is an  अमरीकी  television medical drama that premiered on  the   अमरीकी  Broadcasting Company ( ABC  )  , as a mid-season replacement on  कूच  27  ,  2005 .
The series has  aired  nine seasons  ,  and focuses on the fictional lives of surgical interns and residents as they gradually evolve into seasoned doctors , while trying  to  maintain personal lives .
The show 's premise originated  साथ  Shonda Rhimes  ,   जो   serves   as  an executive producer , along with Betsy Beers , Mark Gordon , Krista Vernoff  ,  Rob Corn , Mark Wilding , and Allan  heinberg  .
The series was created to be racially diverse , utilizing  a  color-blind  ढलाई  technique .
It  is  primarily filmed in Los Angeles ,  कैलिफ़ोर्निया  .
The series ' protagonist is Dr. Meredith Grey ( Ellen Pompeo ) , who originally is accepted into the  रेसिडेंसी  program at the fictional Seattle Grace Hospital .
Meredith is assigned  to  work under Dr. Miranda Bailey ( Chandra Wilson ) , along with Dr. Cristina Yang ( Sandra Oh ) , Dr. George O'Malley  (  T.  R.  Knight ) , Dr. Izzie Stevens ( Katherine Heigl ) , and Dr.  एलेक्स  Karev ( Justin Chambers ) .
Following O'Malley 's  मौत  and Stevens ' departure , the  हॉस्पिटल  's merger with Mercy West brings in Dr. Jackson Avery ( Jesse Williams ) and Dr. April Kepner ( Sarah Drew ) ,  in  the sixth season  .
The surgical wing is primarily supervised by Dr. Richard Webber ( James Pickens , Jr. ) , who  is  eventually  replaced  by Dr. Derek Shepherd ( Patrick Dempsey ) , and later Dr. Owen Hunt ( Kevin McKidd ) .
Dr. Preston Burke ( Isaiah  वॉशिंगटन  ) departs at the conclusion of the third season , and is replaced by Dr. Erica Hahn  (  Brooke Smith ) , who leaves the show during the fifth season , and later Dr. Teddy Altman ( Kim Raver ) , who departs at the end  of  the eighth season .
Introduced in the  दूसरी  season is Dr. Addison Montgomery ( Kate Walsh ) , who leaves the show at the end of the third season , in order to launch her own spin-off medical drama Private Practice .
Dr. Callie Torres (  सारा  Ramirez ) and Dr. Mark Sloan ( Eric Dane ) also enter the show in the second season , while the latter dies in the premiere of the ninth season .
मेरेडिथ  's half-sister , Dr. Lexie Grey ( Chyler Leigh )  ,  appears from  ऋतु  three and dies  at  the end of season eight .
Dr. Arizona Robbins ( Jessica Capshaw ) is given series regular status at the beginning of the sixth season .
Grey 's Anatomy  is  the highest-rated drama in the key 18–49  जनसांख्यिकी  .
Previously among the overall top-ten rated shows in the  संयुक्त  States , Grey 's Anatomy has been well  प्राप्त  by critics .
Considered an impact on culture , the series has received numerous awards , and has also been included in various critics ' top ten lists .
The show has produced several specials , as well as distributed all seasons to DVD ,  और  released a collection of merchandise .
In 2012 , Grey 's Anatomy was named the fifth-highest revenue earning show , in terms of advertising per half-hour .
On May 11 , 2012 , the  श्रेणी  was renewed for a ninth  ऋतु  , which  premiered  on September 27 , 2012 .
Schizophrenia ( or ) is a mental disorder characterized by a breakdown of thought processes and by a deficit of typical emotional responses  .
Common symptoms include auditory hallucinations , paranoid  or  bizarre delusions ,  or  disorganized speech  और  thinking , and it is accompanied by significant  सोशल  or occupational dysfunction .
The  onset  of symptoms typically  occurs  in young adulthood , with  a  global lifetime prevalence of about 0.3–0.7 % .
Diagnosis is based on observed behavior and the  रोगी  's reported experiences .
Genetics , early environment , neurobiology ,  और  psychological  और  social processes appear to  be  important contributory factors ; some recreational and prescription drugs appear to cause or worsen symptoms .
Current  शोध  is focused on the role of neurobiology , although no single isolated organic  कारण  has been found .
The  अनेक   संभावित  combinations of symptoms have triggered debate  परिचय  whether the diagnosis represents a single disorder or a number of  अलहदा  syndromes .
Despite the etymology of the term from the  यूनानी  roots skhizein ( σχίζειν , `` to split '' ) and phrēn , phren- ( φρήν , φρεν-  ;  `` mind '' ) ,  schizophrenia  does not imply  a  ``  विभाजित  personality '' , or `` multiple personality disorder '' ( which is known these days as dissociative identity  विकार  ) —a condition with which it is often confused in public perception .
Rather ,  the  term means a `` splitting of mental functions '' , because of the symptomatic presentation of the illness .
The mainstay of treatment is antipsychotic medication , which primarily suppresses dopamine ( and sometimes serotonin ) receptor  कार्यकलाप  .
Psychotherapy and vocational and social rehabilitation are  भी  important  in  treatment .
In more  गंभीर  cases—where there is risk to self and others— involuntary hospitalization may be necessary , although hospital stays are now shorter and less frequent than they once were  .
The disorder is  विचार  mainly to affect cognition , but  it  also usually contributes  to  chronic problems with behavior  और  emotion .
People with schizophrenia are likely to have additional  (  comorbid ) conditions , including major  अवसाद  and anxiety disorders  ;  the lifetime occurrence of substance use disorder is almost  50  % .
सोशल  problems , such as long-term unemployment , poverty , and homelessness are common .
The average life expectancy of people with the disorder is  12  to 15 years  कम  than those without , the result of increased physical health problems and a higher  आत्महत्या  rate ( about 5 % ) .
Paul Leslie Snider ( April 15 , 1951–August 14 , 1980 ) was the estranged husband and manager of Playboy model Dorothy Stratten , whom he  murdered  before killing  खुद  the same day .
The Epic of Gilgamesh , an epic poem from Mesopotamia , is amongst the earliest surviving works of literature .
The literary history of Gilgamesh  begins   साथ  five independent Sumerian poems about  'bilgamesh  ' ( Sumerian for Gilgamesh ) ,  किंग  of  uruk  .
Four of these  यहूद  used as  सोर्स  material for a combined epic in Akkadian .
This first combined epic , known  as  the `` Old Babylonian '' version  ,   तिथियाँ  to the 18th century BC and is titled after its incipit , Shūtur eli sharrī ( `` Surpassing All Other Kings '' ) .
Only a few fragments of it  have  survived .
The later `` Standard Babylonian '' version dates from the 13th to the 10th centuries  bc  and bears the incipit Sha naqba īmuru ( ``  he  who Saw the Deep '' ) .
Fragments of approximately two thirds of this longer , twelve-tablet  संस्करण   have  been recovered .
Some of the best copies were discovered in the library  तबाह   of  the 7th-century BC Assyrian king Ashurbanipal .
The story centers on a friendship between Gilgamesh  और  Enkidu .
Enkidu is a wild man created by the gods  as  Gilgamesh 's equal to distract  उसे   इससे  oppressing the people of Uruk .
Together , they  यात्रा  to  the  Cedar  पहाड़   to  defeat Humbaba , its monstrous guardian .
Later they kill the Bull of Heaven  ,  which the goddess Ishtar sends  to  punish Gilgamesh for spurning her advances .
As a punishment for these actions , the gods sentence Enkidu to  मौत  .
The  दूसरी  half of the epic focuses on Gilgamesh 's distress at Enkidu  's  death , and his quest for immortality .
In order to learn the secret of eternal  जीवन  , Gilgamesh undertakes a long and perilous journey .
He learns that `` The life that you  हैं  seeking you will never find  .
When the gods created man they allotted to him death , but life they retained in their own keeping . ''
इस  quote was originally attributed to Siduri in the Old Babylonian version of the  एपिक  , and then attributed to the immortal flood hero Utnapishtim in the Akkadian version of the epic .
nevertheless  , Gilgamesh 's fame lived on after his death , because of his great  भवन  projects , and his  खाता  of what Utnapishtim told him happened during the flood .
The  स्टोरी  has been translated into many different  भाषाएं  , and Gilgamesh has since become  adapted   in  works of popular fiction .
A eukaryote ( or ) is an organism whose cells contain complex structures enclosed within membranes .
Eukaryotes may more formally be referred to as the taxon Eukarya or Eukaryota .
The defining membrane-bound structure that sets eukaryotic cells apart from prokaryotic cells is the nucleus , or nuclear envelope , within which the genetic material is carried .
the  presence of a nucleus gives eukaryotes  उनके  name , which comes from the Greek ( eu , `` good '' ) and ( karyon , `` nut  ''   or  `` kernel '' ) .
Most eukaryotic cells also contain other membrane-bound organelles such as mitochondria , chloroplasts and the  golgi  apparatus .
All large complex organisms are  eukaryotes  , including animals , plants and fungi .
The group also includes many unicellular organisms .
Cell division in eukaryotes is different from that in organisms without a nucleus (  prokaryote  ) .
it  involves separating the duplicated chromosomes , through movements directed  by  microtubules .
वहीँ  are two types of  प्रभाग   प्रक्रियाओं  .
In mitosis , one cell divides to produce two genetically  एकसमान  cells .
In meiosis , which is required  in  sexual reproduction , one diploid cell ( having two instances  of  each chromosome , one  इससे  each parent ) undergoes recombination of each pair of parental chromosomes , and then two stages of cell division , resulting in four haploid cells ( gametes ) .
Each gamete  रै  just one  पूरक  of chromosomes , each a unique mix of the corresponding pair of parental  गुणसूत्रों  .
Eukaryota  appears  to  be  monophyletic , and  so  makes up one of the three domains of life .
The two other domains , Bacteria and Archaea ,  हैं  prokaryotes and have none of the above features .
Eukaryotes represent a tiny minority of all living things ; even in a human body there are 10  टाइम्स  more microbes than human cells .
However , due to their much larger size their collective worldwide biomass is estimated at about equal to that of prokaryotes .
They are considered to have first developed approximately 1.6–2.1 billion years ago  .
The use of Internet services or software with Internet access to defraud victims or to otherwise  लो  advantage  of   उन्हें  , for example  by   चोरी  personal information , which can even lead to identity theft .
A very common form of Internet fraud is the distribution of  दुष्ट  security software .
Internet services can be used to present fraudulent solicitations to prospective victims , to conduct fraudulent transactions , or to transmit the proceeds of fraud to financial institutions or to others connected with the scheme .
Internet  धोखाधड़ी  can occur in chat rooms , email , message boards  ,  or on websites .
the  International Security  सहायता  Force ( ISAF ) is a NATO -led  सुरक्षा  mission in Afghanistan  कि  was established by the United Nations Security Council in December 2001 by Resolution  1386  , as envisaged by the Bonn Agreement .
Its main purpose is to train the Afghan National Security  शक्तियां  ( ANSF )  और  assist  अफगानिस्तान   in  rebuilding key government institutions but is also engaged in the 2001-present war with insurgent groups .
ISAF was initially charged with  securing  Kabul and  surrounding  areas from the Taliban , al Qaeda and factional warlords , so as to allow for  the  establishment of the Afghan Transitional  प्रशासन  headed by Hamid Karzai .
In October 2003 , the  un  Security Council authorized the expansion  of  the ISAF mission throughout  अफगानिस्तान  , and ISAF subsequently expanded the mission in four main stages over the whole of the  देश  .
From 2006 to 2011 , ISAF had been involved in increasingly more  intensive  combat operations in southern and eastern Afghanistan .
Troop contributors include from the United States , United Kingdom , NATO member  राज्य  and a number of other countries .
The intensity of the combat faced by contributing nations varies greatly , with the  संयुक्त  States , United Kingdom , and Canada sustaining the majority of casualties in intensive combat operations , with other contributors sustaining significantly less .
As of early 2010 ,  वहीँ  were at least  700  military bases inside Afghanistan but more were expected to be built in the coming years .
About 400 of these were used by American‐led NATO forces and 300  by  ANSF .
Cocaine ( benzoylmethylecgonine  )  ( INN ) is a crystalline tropane alkaloid that  is  obtained from the leaves of the coca plant .
the  name comes  इससे  `` coca '' and  the  alkaloid suffix -ine  ,  forming cocaine .
it  is a stimulant , an appetite suppressant , and a topical anesthetic .
Biologically ,  कोका   अधिनियमों  as a serotonin–norepinephrine–dopamine reuptake inhibitor , also known as a triple reuptake inhibitor ( TRI ) .
It is addictive because of its effect on the mesolimbic reward  pathway  .
Unlike most molecules , cocaine has pockets  साथ  both high hydrophilic and lipophilic efficiency  ,  violating the rule of hydrophilic-lipophilic balance .
This causes it to cross the blood–brain barrier far better than other psychoactive chemicals and may even induce blood-brain  अवरोध  breakdown .
It is illegal to possess , produce , or  वितरित  cocaine for non-medicinal and  non-government-sanctioned  purposes  in  almost  प्रत्येक  country .
Whole beef tri-tip rump , roasted medium  विरल
the  tri-tip is  a  cut of beef from the bottom sirloin primal cut .
It is a small triangular muscle , usually 1.5  to  2.5 lbs . ( 675 to 1,150g ) per side of beef .
The  वैज्ञानिक  name of this muscle is tensor fasciae latae , inserted in the fascia lata , the connective tissue  covering  the quadriceps femoris  ,   भी  called quadriceps extensor , a group of four muscles which in  फेरे  insert in the patella , or  घुटना  cap of the  एनिमल  .
Willmar is a city in ,  और  the county seat of  ,  Kandiyohi County , Minnesota , United  राज्य  .
The population was 19,610  at  the 2010 census .
Willmar has been assigned ZIP code 56201 by the United States Postal  सेवा  .
U.S . Routes 12 and 71 and Minnesota State Highways 23 and 40  हैं  four of the  प्रमुख  routes in the city .
The Speaker of the United States  हाउस  of Representatives ( or Speaker of the House ) is the presiding officer of the  कक्ष   .
The office was established in 1789 by Article I , Section 2 of the  संयुक्त  States  संविधान  , which states in part  ,  `` The House of  प्रतिनिधि  shall chuse their Speaker ... ''
The  वर्तमान  Speaker is John Boehner , a Republican who represents Ohio 's 8th congressional district .
The Constitution does not require that the Speaker  be  a Member of Congress , but no non-member has ever been elected to the office .
The Speaker is second in the  संयुक्त  States presidential line of succession , after the Vice President and ahead of the President pro tempore of the U.S.  सीनेट  .
नापसंद  some Westminster  प्रणाली  parliaments , in which the office of Speaker is considered non-partisan  ,  in the United States the Speaker  of  the House  is  a leadership position and the office-holder actively works to set the majority party 's  विधान  agenda .
The Speaker  प्रायः   करता  not personally preside over debates ,  बजाय  delegating the duty to members of the House from the majority party .
Aside from duties relating to heading the House and the majority political party , the Speaker also performs administrative and procedural functions  ,  and represents  उसके  or her Congressional  ज़िला  .
A bicycle frame is the main component of a bicycle , on to which wheels and other components are fitted .
The modern and most common frame design for an upright bicycle is based on the  सुरक्षा  bicycle  ,  and consists of two triangles , a main triangle and a paired rear triangle .
This is known as the diamond frame .
Frames are required to be strong ,  stiff  and light , which they do by  combining  different materials and shapes .
`` Simple gravity pendulum '' model assumes no friction or air  प्रतिरोध  .
An exemplar animation of a pendulum showing the velocity and acceleration vectors
A pendulum is a weight suspended from a so that it can swing freely .
When a pendulum is  विस्थापित  sideways from its resting equilibrium position ,  it  is subject to a restoring  फ़ोर्स  due to gravity that will accelerate it back  toward  the equilibrium position  .
When released ,  the   restoring  force combined with the pendulum 's mass causes it to oscillate about  the  equilibrium  स्थिति  ,  सुहाने  back and forth .
The time for one complete cycle , a left swing  और  a right swing , is  पुकारा  the period .
A pendulum swings with a  विशिष्ट  period which depends ( mainly ) on its length .
From its discovery around 1602 by Galileo Galilei the regular  गति  of  pendulums  was used for timekeeping ,  और   थी  the  संसार  's most accurate timekeeping technology  जबतक  the 1930s .
Pendulums are used to regulate pendulum clocks , and  हैं  used in scientific instruments such as accelerometers and seismometers .
Historically they were used as  gravimeters  to measure the acceleration of gravity in geophysical surveys , and even as a standard of length .
The word 'pendulum ' is new Latin , from the Latin pendulus , meaning 'hanging ' .
The simple gravity pendulum is an idealized  गणितीय  model of a pendulum .
This is a weight ( or bob ) on the end of a massless  cord  suspended from a , without friction  .
When given an initial push ,  it  will swing  वापस  and forth at a constant amplitude .
Real pendulums are subject to friction and air drag , so the  आयाम  of  उनके  swings declines .
The First Battle of Bull Run , also known as First Manassas ( the name used  by  Confederate forces ) , was fought on July 21 ,  1861  ,  in  Prince William County , Virginia , near the city of  manassas  .
It was the first major land battle of the American Civil War .
Just months after the start of the war at Fort Sumter , the Northern public clamored for a march against the Confederate capital of Richmond , Virginia , which  वे  expected to bring an early end to the  विद्रोह  .
Yielding to political pressure , Brig . Gen. Irvin McDowell  led  his  unseasoned  Union Army across  सांड  Run against the equally inexperienced Confederate Army of Brig . Gen. P. G. T. Beauregard camped near Manassas Junction .
McDowell 's ambitious plan for a surprise flank attack on the Confederate left was  poorly  executed by his  अधिकारियों   और  men ; nevertheless , the Confederates , who had been  नियोजन  to attack the Union left flank  ,  found themselves at an initial  disadvantage  .
Confederate reinforcements under Brig . Gen.  जोसेफ  E. Johnston arrived from the Shenandoah Valley  by  railroad and the course of the battle quickly changed .
A brigade of Virginians under a relatively unknown colonel from the Virginia Military Institute , Thomas J. Jackson , stood their ground and Jackson received his famous  उपनाम  ,  ``  Stonewall Jackson '' .
The Confederates then launched a strong counterattack , and as the Union troops began withdrawing under fire  ,   अनेक  panicked and it turned into a rout as McDowell 's men frantically ran without order in the direction of Washington , D.C .
Both armies were  sobered  by the fierce  लड़  and many casualties  ,   और  realized the war was going  to  be  much  longer and bloodier than either had anticipated  .

Weather is the state of the atmosphere , to the degree that it is hot or cold , wet or dry , calm or stormy , clear or  cloudy  .
Most weather phenomena  occur  in the troposphere , just below the stratosphere .
Weather generally refers to day-to-day temperature and precipitation activity , whereas climate is the term  लिये  the average atmospheric conditions over longer periods of  समय  .
When used without qualification , ``  मौसम  '' is understood to  be  the weather of Earth .
मौसम  is driven by air pressure ( temperature and moisture ) differences between one place and another .
These pressure and temperature differences can occur due to the sun angle at  कोई  particular spot , which varies by latitude from the tropics .
The  दमदार  temperature contrast between  ध्रुवीय  and tropical air gives  वृद्धि   to  the jet  स्ट्रीम  .
Weather systems in the mid-latitudes , such as extratropical cyclones , are  caused  by instabilities of the jet stream flow .
Because the Earth 's  अक्ष  is tilted relative to  इसके  orbital  प्लेन  , sunlight is  घटना  at different angles  at  different times of  the  year .
On Earth 's surface ,  temperatures  usually  दायरा  ±40 °C (  −40  °F  to  100  °f  ) annually  .
Over thousands of years ,  परिवर्तन  in Earth 's orbit affect  the  amount and  वितरण  of solar  उर्जा  received by  the  Earth and  influence  long-term climate and global climate change .
Surface temperature differences in  फेरे  cause pressure differences .
Higher altitudes are  कूलर  than lower altitudes due to differences in compressional heating .
मौसम  forecasting is the application of science and  प्रौद्योगिकी   to  predict the state of the atmosphere for a future time and a given location .
The  माहौल   is  a chaotic system , so small changes to one  भाग  of the system can grow to have large effects  on  the system  as  a whole .
Human attempts  to  control  the  weather have occurred throughout human history , and there is evidence that human  कार्यकलाप  such as agriculture and industry has inadvertently modified weather patterns .
Studying how the weather works on  अन्य  planets has been helpful in understanding how weather works on Earth  .
A famous landmark in the Solar System , Jupiter  's   ग्रेट  Red Spot , is an anticyclonic storm known to have existed for at least 300 years .
however  , weather is  नहीं  limited to planetary bodies .
A star  's   किरीट  is  constantly  being lost to  स्पेस  , creating what is essentially a very thin atmosphere throughout  the  Solar System .
The movement  of  mass ejected from the Sun is  ज्ञात  as the  सौर  wind .
कैटी  Perry is an American singer-songwriter from Santa Barbara , California .
वो  signed with Capitol Records .
Perry has released  तीन  studio albums ,  सहित  her debut  ईसाई  effort Katy Hudson , One of the Boys , and  teenage  Dream .
पेरी  's mainstream career was kicked off with the massive chart success of her debut single `` I Kissed a Girl ``  .
During her career , Perry has been nominated for  numerous  major music awards , primarily for Teenage Dream and One  of  the Boys .
The following is a list of sovereign states and territories where English  is  an official language or language of government .
In  2012  , there were 88 states in total ( 60 sovereign states  और  28 non-sovereign states ) .
In many countries English is the dominant language  ,   लकिन   करता  not have official status .
In Australia , English is spoken by the vast majority of the population and is the only  भाषा  used  in  government institutions  ,  but Australia does not have an official language .
The case is the same  in  the United Kingdom and the United States ,  हालांकि  many states and regions within  the  U.S. do  have  English as an official language .
English is the dominant language of New  जीलैंड  and  an  official language of Canada ( along with French ) , India  (  along with Hindi and  अनेक  other languages ) , Ireland  (  along with Irish ) ,  और  the Philippines ( along with Tagalog  )  .
English is the sole official language of the Commonwealth of Nations and the Commonwealth Games .
English is  एक  of the official languages of the United Nations , the European Union and the International Olympic Committee .
Many of these  देशों  are current or former colonies  or  dependencies of the United Kingdom (  देखिए  also British Empire  )  , or of the United States , itself a former colony of the UK .
Notable exceptions include Rwanda ,  जिससे  was a former Belgian colony and Eritrea  ,  which was an Italian colony where the British Empire spanned  इसके  control only in World  युद्ध  II and shortly  बाद   (  1941-1952 ) .
India 's linguistic picture is complex  .
According to the Constitution of India , `` Hindi in the Devanagari script '' is the  आधिकारिक  language of the union ; and English the 'subsidiary official language ' ;  however  , English is mandated for the authoritative texts of all federal  कानून  and Supreme Court decisions and  (  along with Hindi ) is one of the two languages of the Indian Parliament .
English is used almost exclusively for higher education , business and science .
Courses in majority of the schools  हैं  taught  exclusively  in  अंग्रेज़ी  .
English is extensively used for administrative purposes in India .
India is  the  second-largest English-speaking country in  the  world by number of speakers , after the United States .
as  such , many consider English to be the  de   facto  official language of India .
See Official languages of India .
The linguistic  मेकअप   of  Pakistan is similarly complex .
While the national language is  उर्दू  , English is an official language and used  in  business  ,  government and law .
अंग्रेज़ी  is  a  compulsory language in schools .
All school courses are taught in  अंग्रेज़ी  .
Pakistan is the 9th largest English-speaking country in the world by population .
Southern Cone ( , ) is a  भौगोलिक  region composed of the southernmost areas of South America , south of the Tropic of Capricorn .
Although geographically this includes Southern and part of Southeast ( São Paulo ) of Brazil ,  in  terms of political geography the Southern cone has traditionally comprised  अर्जेंटीना  , Chile , Paraguay , and Uruguay .
In  the  narrowest sense , it only  कवर  Argentina , Chile  और  Uruguay , bounded on the north by the states of Brazil , Paraguay , Bolivia and  पेरू  , on the west by the Pacific Ocean , and south to the junction between the Pacific  और  Atlantic Oceans , which it  is  the closest continental area of Antarctica (  1000  km ) .
High life  प्रत्याशा  , the highest Human Development Index of Latin  अमेरिका  , high Standard of living , significant participation in the global markets  और  the  उभरते  economy of its members make the Southern Cone the most prosperous macro-region in South America .
For multi-event athletic competitions  देखिए  Track and Field Competitions , section ``  बैठक  '' .
Meetings are sometimes held around conference tables .
In a meeting , two or more people come together to discuss one or more topics , often in  a  formal setting  .
An official game in baseball , also  sometimes  called  a  regulation game , is a game that has progressed beyond the point at which it can  be  considered complete if necessary .
This is approximately the halfway point of  the  game  .
In the case of inclement weather , any game which has  पहुँचे  this point  may  be stopped and shortened as needed , with the result being final , and all records and statistics counted .
A game which has  नहीं  reached this point before being  रोका  is either considered a  निलंबित  game ( to be continued at a later date from the point of stoppage ) , or is simply canceled and  replayed  from the start .
( This depends  on  the rules of each  व्यक्तिगत  league . )
In either  मामला  , no statistics are  गिने  until the  खेल   becomes  official .
Since most professional baseball games are  नौ  innings long , the fifth inning is used as the threshold for an official game .
If the visiting team is leading ,  or  the  खेल  is tied  ,  the end of the fifth inning marks  इस  point .
if  the home team  (  which bats last )  is  already ahead in  the  score , and  theoretically  would not need its half of the fifth  inning  , then 41⁄2 innings ( i.e. , the  मध्य  of the fifth ) is considered  an  official game .
The game is also considered official if the home team scores to take the lead in the bottom of the fifth inning , since the  खेल  would end immediately if the  वही  thing happened in  the  ninth .
In nearly all cases , the `` official game '' status is used to determine whether a rain  जाँच   होगा  be honored for fans holding tickets .
If  a  game is started but does  नहीं  reach the point of becoming official  ,  fans are entitled to a new ticket for the make-up game or  (  in most cases ) any other available game of their choice .
If a game is  halted  after it  becomes  official , the game is simply shortened and no rain check is given .
The `` official game '' statistic received some attention during the 1995 season , when Cal Ripken , Jr. was approaching the record for  लगातार   खेल  played , previously held by Lou Gehrig .
Large  संख्याएँ  were  लटका  on the side of the B & O  गोदाम   at  Oriole Park at Camden Yards to show the number of games in Ripken 's streak .
Each day , a new number was unfurled  दौरान  the fifth inning after each  खेल  had become  आधिकारिक  ( since  the  statistic  होता  not have counted if the game had been stopped before that point ) .
A  समान  practice has  महरूम  used to count down toward  the  demolition of several stadiums (  सहित  Veterans Stadium  in  Philadelphia in 2003 , Busch  मेमोरियल  Stadium in  st.  Louis in 2005 , and  the  original Yankee Stadium and Shea  स्टेडियम  in New  यॉर्क  City in 2008 ) ; as each game became official , the team would unveil  a  new ( lower ) number showing the number of games left to be played  in  the stadium .
A telephone number or phone number  is  a sequence of digits used to call from one telephone  लकीर  to another in a public switched telephone network .
When telephone numbers were invented , they were short — as few as one , two or three digits — and were given orally to a switchboard operator .
As  फोन  systems have grown and interconnected to encompass the world , telephone numbers have become longer .
in  addition to telephones , they now access other devices ,  ऐसे  as computers and fax  मशीने  .
The  क्रमांक  contains the information necessary to identify uniquely the intended endpoint for the  टेलीफोन  call  .
Each such endpoint must have a  अद्वितीय  number within the public switched telephone network .
Most countries use fixed length numbers ( for normal lines at least ) and  इसलिए   the  number of endpoints determines the necessary length of the telephone number .
it  is also possible for each subscriber to have a set of shorter numbers for the endpoints most often used .
These `` shorthand '' or `` speed calling  ''  numbers are  automatically  translated  to  unique telephone numbers before the call can be connected .
Some special services have their own short numbers ( e.g. , 1-1-9 ,  9-1-1  , 0-0-0 , 9-9-9 , 1-1-1 , and 1-1-2 being the Emergency  सेवाएं  numbers for China , Japan , South Korea , Taiwan and Sri Lanka ; Canada and the United States ; Australia ; the United Kingdom , Ireland ,  दक्षिण  Africa , Poland , Saudi Arabia ,  the  United Arab Emirates , Morocco , Macao , Bahrain , Qatar , Bangladesh , Botswana , Ghana , Kenya , Hong Kong , Malaysia , Mauritius , Singapore  ,  Zimbabwe  ,  Trinidad , Tobago ; New Zealand ; Kuwait and the European Union ,  क्रमशः  . )
Many systems also allow calls within a local area to be made without dialing the local area code .
For example , a phone number in North  अमेरिका  will start with three numbers ( such as 661 ) , which is the area code  ,   followed   by  seven digits split  into  sections of three and four ( such as 550-1212 ) , which is the local number .
Some areas now have mandatory ten-digit dialing in place , even for local calls .
Most telephone  संजाल  today  (  exceptions being private intercom and secure phone networks )  हैं  interconnected in the international telephone network , where the format of telephone numbers is standardized by ITU-T in the recommendation E.164 .
This specifies that the entire number should be 15  अंक  or shorter , and begin with a country prefix .
लिये  most countries , this is followed by an area code or city code and the subscriber number ,  जिससे  might  consist  of the code  लिये  a particular telephone exchange .
ITU-T recommendation E.123 describes how to represent an international telephone number in writing or print , starting with a plus sign ( `` + '' ) and the country code  .
When calling an international  क्रमांक  from a  फिक्स्ड  line phone , the + must be replaced  साथ  the  अंतरराष्ट्रीय  call prefix chosen by  the  country the call is  होने  made from .
Some  मोबाईल  phones allow the + to be entered  सीधे  .
the  format and allocation of local phone numbers are controlled by each nation 's respective government , either directly or by sponsored organizations ( such as NANPA overseen by NeuStar Inc. ) .
Before a telephone call is connected , the telephone number must  be  dialed by the calling party or Caller .
the  called party might have equipment that  presents  caller ID before the call is answered .
A collection agency is  a  business  कि  pursues payments of  debts  owed by individuals  or  businesses .
Most collection agencies operate as agents of creditors and collect debts for a fee  or  percentage of the total amount owed .
There are  अनेक  types  of  collection agencies .
First-party agencies are  oftentimes  subsidiaries of the original company the debt is owed to .
Third-party agencies are separate companies contracted by a company to collect debts on their behalf for a fee .
Debt  खरीदार  purchase the debt at a percentage of its value , then attempt to collect it .
Each country has its own rules and regulations regarding them  .

Cannabis , also known as marijuana ( from the Mexican Spanish marihuana ) , and by other names , is a preparation of the Cannabis plant intended for use as a psychoactive drug and as  आयुर्विज्ञान  .
Pharmacologically , the principal psychoactive constituent of cannabis is tetrahydrocannabinol ( THC ) ; it is one  of  483  ज्ञात  compounds in the plant , including at least 84  अन्य   cannabinoids  , such as  cannabidiol  ( CBD ) , cannabinol ( CBN  )  , tetrahydrocannabivarin ( THCV ) .
and cannabigerol ( CBG ) .
This is a list of American football quarterbacks who have started for the Washington Redskins , as well as its predecessors the Boston Braves ( 1932 ) and  बोस्टन  Redskins  (   1933  –  1936  ) , in the National Football League ( NFL ) .
the   वॉशिंगटन  Redskins franchise was originally founded in  बोस्टन  , Massachusetts as the  बोस्टन  Braves , named after the local baseball franchise .
The name was changed the following year to the Redskins .
In  1937  , the franchise moved to Washington  ,  D.C .
Of  the  49 Redskins starting quarterbacks , two  have  been inducted into the  प्रो   फ़ुटबॉल  Hall of Fame : Sammy Baugh and Sonny Jurgensen .

1st Special Forces Operational  detachment-delta  ( 1st SFOD-D ) , popularly known as Delta Force ,  is  one of the  संयुक्त  States ' four secretive tier-one counter-terrorism and Special Mission Units .
It was formerly listed as the Combat Applications Group by the Department of  रक्षा   लकिन  has since been officially re-designated the Army Compartmented Elements ( ACE ) .
While 1st SFOD-D is administratively supported  by  USASOC , it falls  अंतर्गत  the operational control of the Joint Special Operations Command  .
डेल्टा  Force  और  its Navy counterpart , the Naval  खास  Warfare Development Group , are the United States military 's primary counter-terrorism units .
Delta Force  's  primary tasks are counter-terrorism ,  सीधा  action , and national  हस्तक्षेप  operations  ,  although it  is  an extremely versatile group capable of conducting many  प्रकार  of covert missions ,  सहित  , but not limited to , hostage rescues and raids .
The Central Intelligence Agency 's  अत्यधिक  secretive Special  क्रियाएँ  Division ( SAD ) and more specifically its elite Special Operations Group ( SOG ) often works with  –  and recruits – operators from Delta Force .
Alpha decay is one example type of radioactive decay , in which  an  atomic nucleus emits an alpha particle ,  और  thereby transforms ( or 'decays ' ) into an atom with a mass number  4  less and atomic number 2  कम  .
Many other types of decays are possible .
Radioactive decay , also known as nuclear decay or  radioactivity  , is the process by which a nucleus of an unstable atom loses energy by emitting particles of  आयनकारी  radiation .
a  material that spontaneously emits  इस  kind of radiation — which includes the emission of energetic alpha particles , beta particles , and gamma rays — is considered radioactive .
There are many  अलग  types of radioactive  क्षय  ( see table below ) .
A decay ,  or  loss of energy , results  जब  an atom with one type of nucleus ,  पुकारा  the parent radionuclide , transforms  to  an atom with a nucleus in a different state  ,  or to a different nucleus containing different numbers of protons and  neutrons  .
Either of these products is named the daughter nuclide .
In  कुछ  decays  the  parent and daughter are different chemical elements , and thus the decay process  परिणाम  in nuclear transmutation  (  creation of  an  atom  of  a new element ) .
The first decay processes to be discovered were alpha decay , beta decay , and gamma decay .
Alpha decay occurs when the nucleus ejects an alpha particle ( helium nucleus ) .
This  is  the most common process of emitting nucleons , but in rarer types of decays , nuclei can eject protons , or specific nuclei  of  other elements ( in the process called cluster decay  )  .
Beta decay occurs when the nucleus emits an electron or positron and a type of neutrino , in a process that changes a proton to a neutron or the other way around .
The nucleus may capture  an  orbiting electron , converting a proton into a neutron ( electron  कैप्चर  ) .
All of  ये  processes result in nuclear transmutation .
By contrast ,  वहीँ   मौजूद  radioactive decay processes that do not result in transmutation .
The energy of an excited nucleus may be emitted as a  गामा  ray in gamma decay , or used to eject an orbital electron by interaction with the excited nucleus in a process called internal conversion .
Radioisotopes occasionally emit neutrons  ,  and this results in a change in an element from one  समस्थानिक  to another .
One type of radioactive decay results in products which are not defined , but appear in  a  range of `` pieces '' of the  असली  nucleus  .
This decay is called spontaneous fission .
इस  decay happens when a large unstable nucleus spontaneously splits into two ( and occasionally three  )  smaller daughter nuclei , and usually  emits  gamma rays , neutrons , or other particles as a  consequence  .
Radioactive decay is a stochastic  (  i.e. , random ) process at the level of single atoms , in that  ,  according to quantum theory  ,  it is impossible to predict when a particular atom will decay .
However , the chance that a given atom will decay is constant over time .
For a large number  of  atoms , the decay rate for the collection is computable from the measured decay constants of the nuclides ( or equivalently  इससे  the half-lifes ) .
Waxing is  a  form of semi-permanent hair removal which removes the hair from the root .
New  बाल   होगा  not grow back in the previously waxed area for two to eight weeks , although some people will start to see  regrowth  in only a week .
Almost any area of the body can be waxed , including eyebrows , face  ,  bikini area , legs , arms , back , abdomen and feet .
There are  अनेक  types of waxing  उपयुक्त  for removing unwanted  बाल  .
Strip waxing  is  accomplished by spreading a wax thinly over the  स्किन   .
A cloth or paper strip is then pressed  on  the top  और  ripped  बंद  the direction of  बाल  growth .
This removes the wax along with the hair  .
Strip wax can also be made at home using lemon juice , water , sugar and honey .
Hot waxing utilizes Hot wax ( as opposed to strip wax ) .
in  this case , the wax is applied somewhat  thickly  and  साथ  no cloth or paper strips  .
The wax  तब  hardens when it cools , thus allowing the easy removal by a therapist without the aid of cloths .
This waxing method is very beneficial to people who  have  sensitive skin .
Wall  पेंटिंग  ( 1st century  ad  ) from Pompeii depicting a  multigenerational  banquet
Ancient Roman culture existed throughout the almost 1200-year history of the civilization of Ancient Rome .
The term refers to the culture of the Roman Republic , later the Roman Empire , which ,  at  its peak , covered an  क्षेत्रफल  from Lowland Scotland and Morocco to  the  Euphrates .
Life in ancient Rome revolved around the city of Rome , its famed seven hills , and its monumental structures such as the Flavian Amphitheatre ( now called the Colosseum ) , the Forum of Trajan , and the Pantheon .
The city  भी  had several theaters , gymnasiums  ,  and many taverns , baths , and brothels .
throughout  the territory under ancient Rome 's control , residential architecture ranged from very modest houses to country  विला  , and in the capital city of Rome , there were imperial residences on the elegant Palatine Hill , from  जिससे  the word palace is derived .
The  विशाल  majority of the population lived in the  नगर  center , packed into insulae ( apartment blocks ) .
The city of Rome was the largest megalopolis  of  that time , with  a  population that may well have exceeded one million people , with a high end estimate of 3.6  लाख  and a low end estimate of 450,000 .
Historical estimates indicate that around 30 percent of the population under the city 's jurisdiction lived in innumerable urban centers , with population of at  तनिक  10,000 and several military settlements , a very high rate of urbanization by pre-industrial  मानकों  .
The most urbanized part of the Empire was Italy , which had an estimated rate of urbanization of 32 %  ,   the  same rate of urbanization of England in 1800 .
Most Roman towns and  शहरों  had a forum , temples and the same type of buildings , on a smaller scale , as found in  रोम   .
the  large urban  जनसांख्यिकी  required an endless supply of  खाना  which was a  जटिल  logistical task , including acquiring , transporting , storing and distribution of food for Rome and other urban centers .
Italian  खेतो  supplied vegetables and fruits , but fish and meat were luxuries .
aqueducts  were built to bring water to urban centers and wine and oil were imported from Hispania , Gaul  और  Africa .
There was a very large  राशि  of commerce between the provinces of the Roman Empire , since  इसके  transportation technology was very efficient .
The average costs of transport and  the  technology were  comparable  with 18th-century Europe .
The later city of Rome did not fill the space within  इसके  ancient Aurelian walls until after 1870 .
Eighty percent of the population under the jurisdiction of ancient Rome  जिया   in  the  countryside   in  settlements with less than 10 thousand inhabitants .
Landlords generally  resided  in cities and their estates  यहूद  left in the care of farm managers  .
The  दुर्दशा  of rural slaves was generally worse  than  their counterparts working in urban aristocratic households .
To stimulate a higher labor productivity most landlords freed a large number of slaves  और  many received wages  .
Some records indicate that `` as many as 42 people lived in one  छोटी  farm  हट  in  मिश्र  , while six families  स्वामित्व  a single olive tree . '' .
Such a rural environment continued to induce migration of population to urban centers until the early 2nd century , when the urban population stopped growing and started to decline .
Starting in the middle of the 2nd century BC , private Greek culture was increasingly in ascendancy , in spite  of  tirades against the `` softening '' effects of Hellenized culture from the conservative moralists .
By the time of Augustus , cultured Greek household slaves taught the Roman young ( sometimes even the girls ) ; chefs , decorators , secretaries , doctors , and hairdressers—all  आए  from the Greek East  .
Greek sculptures adorned Hellenistic  लैंडस्केप  gardening on the Palatine or in the villas , or were  imitated  in Roman sculpture yards by Greek slaves .
The Roman cuisine preserved in the cookery books ascribed to Apicius is essentially Greek .
Roman writers disdained  लैटिन  for a cultured  यूनानी  style .
Only in law and governance was the  तिरछा  nature of Rome 's accretive culture supreme  .
Against this  इंसान  background , both the urban and  ग्रामीण  setting , one  of  history 's most influential civilizations took shape , leaving behind a cultural legacy that survives in part  आज  .
James Joseph `` Duffy '' Waldorf , Jr. ( born August 20 , 1962 ) is an American professional golfer .

A modern `` French Kilner '' jar
Glass production involves two main methods – the float glass process , which produces  चादर  glass , and glassblowing which  produces  bottles and other containers .
A  ऋतु  is a  subdivision  of the year , marked by changes in  मौसम  , ecology , and hours of daylight .
Seasons result from the yearly  क्रान्ति  of  the  Earth around the Sun and the tilt of  the  Earth 's axis relative to the plane of revolution .
In temperate and polar regions  ,  the seasons are marked by changes in the intensity of sunlight that reaches the Earth 's surface , variations  of  which may cause animals to go into hibernation or to migrate , and plants to be dormant .
During May , June and  जुलाई  , the northern hemisphere is exposed to  अधिक  direct sunlight because the hemisphere faces the sun .
The same is true  of  the southern hemisphere in November , December and January .
It is the tilt  of  the Earth  कि  causes  the  Sun to be higher in  the  sky  दौरान  the summer months which increases the solar flux .
However , due to  मौसमी  lag , June  ,  July and August are the hottest months in the northern hemisphere and December , January and February are the hottest months in the southern hemisphere .
In temperate and subpolar regions , generally four calendar -based seasons ( with their  adjectives  ) are recognized : spring ( vernal ) , summer ( estival ) ,  पतझड़  ( autumnal )  और  winter ( hibernal )  .
However , ecologists mostly use a six season model for temperate climate regions that includes pre-spring ( prevernal ) and late  गर्मियाँ  ( serotinal ) as distinct seasons along with the traditional four .
Hot regions have  दो  or three seasons ; the rainy ( or wet  ,  or monsoon ) season and the dry season , and in some tropical areas , a cool or mild  ऋतु  .
In some parts  of  the world  ,  special `` seasons '' are  loosely  defined based on important events such as a  hurricane  season , tornado  ऋतु  or a wildfire season .
The six ecological seasons

The Battle of Fort Sumter (  अप्रैल   12–14  , 1861 )  थी  the bombardment and  आत्मसमर्पण  of Fort  sumter  , near Charleston , South Carolina , that  प्रारंभ  the American Civil War .
Following  घोषणाओं  of secession by seven Southern states , South Carolina demanded that the U.S. Army abandon its  सुविधाएं  in Charleston Harbor .
On December 26 , 1860 , U.S. Major Robert Anderson  surreptitiously  moved  उसके  small command from the indefensible Fort Moultrie on  सुलीवान  's Island to Fort Sumter , a substantial fortress controlling the entrance of Charleston Harbor .
An attempt by U.S. President James Buchanan to reinforce and resupply Anderson , using  the  unarmed merchant  जलयान  Star of the  वेस्ट   ,  failed  जब  it was fired upon by shore batteries on January 9 , 1861  .
South Carolina authorities then seized all Federal property in the  चार्ल्सटन  area , except for  फोर्ट  Sumter .
During the early months of 1861 , the situation around Fort Sumter increasingly began  to  resemble  a  siege .
In  कूच  ,  ब्रिगेडियर  . Gen. P. G. T.  beauregard  , the first general officer of the newly formed Confederate States of America , was placed in command of Confederate  शक्तियां   in  Charleston .
Beauregard  energetically  directed the strengthening of batteries around Charleston harbor aimed  at  Fort Sumter .
Conditions in the  फोर्ट   grew  dire as the Union  सैनिको  rushed to complete the installation of additional guns .
Anderson was short of men , food , and supplies .
The resupply of Fort Sumter  became  the first  संकट   of  the administration of President Abraham Lincoln .
He notified the  राज्यपाल  of South Carolina , Francis W. Pickens , that he was  sending  supply ships , which resulted in an ultimatum from  the  Confederate government :  evacuate  Fort Sumter immediately .
Major Anderson refused to  आत्मसमर्पण  .
Beginning at  4:30  a.m. on April 12 , the Confederates bombarded  the  fort from artillery batteries surrounding the harbor .
Although the Union garrison returned fire ,  वे   यहूद  significantly outgunned and , after 34 hours  ,  Major Anderson agreed to evacuate  .
There was no loss of life on  either  side as a direct result  of  this engagement , although  a  gun explosion  दौरान  the  आत्मसमर्पण  ceremonies on April 14 caused two Union deaths .
Following the battle , there was widespread support  इससे  both North and South for further military action .
Lincoln 's immediate call for 75,000 volunteers to suppress the rebellion resulted in an additional four southern slave states also declaring their secession and joining the Confederacy .
The Civil War had begun  .
3g  , short for third Generation ,  is  the third generation of mobile telecommunications technology .
3G telecommunication networks support services  कि   provide  an information transfer rate of at  तनिक  200 kbit/s  .
However ,  अनेक  services advertised as 3G provide higher speed than the minimum technical requirements for a 3G service .
Recent  3g  releases , often denoted 3.5G and 3.75G , also provide mobile broadband access of several Mbit/s to smartphones  और   मोबाईल  modems in laptop computers .
3G  पाता  application  in  wireless voice telephony , mobile Internet  अभिगम  , fixed wireless Internet access , video calls and  मोबाईल  TV .
`` Mazel Tov ! ''  लिखा  on a wine glass tag
traditionally   ,  after the groom breaks the glass , the guests shout `` Mazel Tov ! `` .
A birthday cake , iced with the words `` מזל טוב '' ( mazal tov ) , as is often done in Israel .
Here the phrase is written in Hebrew cursive .
`` Mazel tov '' or  ``  mazal tov '' ( Hebrew / Yiddish : `` מזל טוב '' , Hebrew :  ``  mazal tov '' ; Yiddish :  ``  mazel tov '' ; lit .
`` good luck '' ) is a phrase used to express congratulations for  a  happy and significant occasion or event .
hepatitis  C is an infectious disease affecting primarily the liver ,  caused  by the hepatitis C virus  (  HCV ) .
the  infection is often asymptomatic , but chronic infection can lead to scarring  of  the  जिगर  and ultimately to cirrhosis , which  is  generally apparent after many years .
In some cases , those with cirrhosis will  go  on to develop liver  विफलता  ,  जिगर   कर्कट  or life-threatening esophageal and gastric varices .
HCV is spread primarily by blood-to-blood contact  संबद्ध  with intravenous  ड्रग  use , poorly sterilized  चिकित्सा  equipment and transfusions .
an  estimated 130–200 million people worldwide are infected with .
the  existence of ( originally `` non- A  non-  B hepatitis '' ) was postulated in the 1970s  और  proven in 1989 .
only infects humans and chimpanzees .
The virus persists in the liver in  परिचय  85 % of those infected .
This persistent infection can be treated with medication : the standard therapy is a combination of peginterferon and ribavirin , with  either  boceprevir or telaprevir added in some cases .
overall  , 50–80  %  of  लोगों  treated are cured .
Those who develop cirrhosis or liver cancer may require a liver transplant .
is the leading  कारण  of liver transplantation , though the virus usually recurs after transplantation .
No vaccine against is available .
A flexible spending  खाता  ( FSA )  ,  also known as a flexible spending arrangement , is one of  a  number of tax-advantaged financial accounts that can be set up through a  कैफेटेरिया  plan of  an  employer in the United States .
An FSA allows an employee to set aside a portion of earnings to pay for qualified expenses as established in the  कैफेटेरिया  plan , most commonly for medical  खर्च  but often for dependent  परवाह  or other expenses .
Money deducted from an employee 's pay into an FSA is not subject to payroll taxes , resulting in substantial payroll tax savings .
One significant  disadvantage  to using an FSA is that funds not used by the end of the plan  साल  are lost to the employee , known as the  ``  use  it  or lose it '' rule .
The most common type  of  flexible spending account  ,  the medical expense FSA ( also medical FSA or health FSA ) ,  is  similar to a  स्वास्थ्य   बचत  account ( HSA ) or a health reimbursement account ( HRA  )  .
However , while HSAs and HRAs are almost exclusively used as components  of  a consumer driven health care plan , medical FSAs are commonly  offered  with more  परंपरागत  health plans as well  .
In addition , funds in a  स्वास्थ्य  savings account are not lost when  the  plan year is over , unlike funds in an FSA .
Paper forms or an FSA debit card , also known as a Flexcard , may be used to access the account funds .
टेनेसी  ( ) (  )  is a U.S. state located in the Southeastern United States .
Tennessee is the 36th most  extensive  and the 17th  सबसे   populous  of the 50 United States .
Tennessee is bordered by Kentucky and Virginia to the north , North Carolina to the  ईस्ट   ,  Georgia  ,   अलबामा  , and Mississippi to the south ,  और   अरकंसास  and Missouri to the west .
The Appalachian Mountains dominate the  पूर्वी  part of the state , and the Mississippi River forms  the  state 's western  किनारा  .
Tennessee 's capital and second largest city is Nashville , which has a population of  609,644  .
Memphis is the state 's largest city , with a population  of   652,050  .
The state of Tennessee is rooted in the Watauga  संघ  , a 1772 frontier pact generally regarded as the first constitutional government west of the Appalachians .
What is  अभी  Tennessee was  initially  part of North Carolina  ,  and later part of the Southwest Territory .
Tennessee was admitted to  the  Union as the 16th state  on  June 1 , 1796 .
Tennessee was the last state to leave the Union and join the Confederacy  at  the  outbreak  of the U.S. Civil War in  1861  , and the first state to be readmitted to the Union at the end  of  the war  .
Tennessee furnished more soldiers for the Confederate Army than any  अन्य  state , and more  सैनिको  for the Union Army than any other Southern state .
In the 20th century , Tennessee  transitioned  from an agrarian economy to a more diversified economy , aided at  टाइम्स  by federal  entities  such as the  टेनेसी  Valley Authority .
In  the  early 1940s , the  नगर  of Oak Ridge was established to house the Manhattan Project 's uranium enrichment facilities , helping to build the world 's first atomic bomb .
Tennessee has played a critical role in the development of many forms of American popular music , including rock and roll , blues ,  देश  , and  rockabilly   .
Beale Street in Memphis is considered by many to be  the  birthplace of the blues , with musicians such as W.C . Handy performing in its clubs  as  early as 1909 .
Memphis was also home to Sun  रिकॉर्ड   ,  where musicians such as Elvis Presley  ,  Isaac Hayes , Johnny Cash , Carl Perkins , Jerry Lee Lewis , Roy Orbison  ,   और  Charlie Rich began their recording careers  ,  and where rock and roll took shape in the 1950s .
The 1927 Victor recording sessions in Bristol generally mark the beginning of the country music genre and the rise of the Grand Ole Opry in the 1930s helped make Nashville the center of the  देश   म्यूज़िक  recording industry .
Three bricks  और  mortar museums recognize Tennessee 's role  in  nurturing various forms of popular music : the Memphis  चट्टान  N ' Soul Museum  ,  the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum in Nashville , and the International  rock-a-billy  Museum in Jackson .
In addition , the Rockabilly Hall of Fame , an online site recognizing the development of rockabilly in which Tennessee played  a   निर्णायक  role  ,  is  आधारित  in Nashville  .
Tennessee 's major industries include agriculture , manufacturing , and tourism .
Poultry , soybeans , and cattle are  the   राज्य  's primary agricultural  उत्पाद  , and major manufacturing exports include chemicals , transportation  उपकरण  , and electrical equipment .
The Great Smoky Mountains National  पार्क  , the nation 's most visited national park , is headquartered in the eastern part of the state , and a section of the Appalachian Trail roughly follows the Tennessee-North Carolina border .
Other major tourist attractions include the Tennessee Aquarium in Chattanooga , the  sunsphere  in Knoxville , Dollywood in Pigeon Forge , the  पार्थेनन  , the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum ,  और  Ryman Auditorium in Nashville , and Elvis  प्रेस्ली  's Graceland residence and tomb in Memphis  .
एक  design variant  of  a cock ring .
A cock ring is  a  ring  कि  can be placed around a man 's penis , usually at the base , primarily to slow the flow of blood from the  वीर्यपात  penile tissue  ,  thus maintaining an erection  लिये  a much longer period of time .
Cock rings can be worn around just  the  penis or both the penis and  scrotum  , or just  the  scrotum  अलोन  , though this is usually called a testicle cuff .
Rings can be made of a variety  of  different materials , most commonly leather , rubber , or silicone ,  हालांकि  nylon and metal are also used either as the  प्रमुख  component or part  of  the closure  .
The term cock ring is sometimes used as a synonym for a Prince Albert piercing ,  a  piercing of the penis that is usually , though not always , a metal ring  .
When  प्रयुक्त  in cases of erectile  dysfunction  they are known by various names such as  ``  erection  रिंग  '' and  ``  tension ring  ''  .
the  headquarters of  प्रमुख  League Baseball at 245 Park Avenue  ,  Midtown Manhattan , New York City , USA .
Major League Baseball ( MLB )  is  a  पेशेवर  baseball league , consisting of teams that  खेल  in the National League and the American  लीग  .
Dating to 1876 and  1901  respectively , the two leagues merged in 2000 into a single organization led by the Commissioner of Baseball , after 100 years as separate legal entities .
एमएलबी  constitutes  एक  of the major professional sports leagues of the United States and Canada .
It is composed of 30 teams — 29 in the United States and one in  कनाडा  .
Teams in MLB play 162 games each season over six months ( April through September ) .
Five  टीमों  in each league advance to a four-round postseason tournament that culminates in the  संसार  Series ,  a  best-of-seven-games championship series between the  दो  league champions  जिससे  dates to 1903 .
The organization oversees many minor-league baseball leagues which operate about 240 teams affiliated with the major-league clubs .
With the International Baseball Federation , the league also manages the international World Baseball Classic tournament .
MLB has the  उच्चतम  season attendance of  कोई  sports  लीग  in the world with  nearly  75 million spectators in  2012  .
Delaware ( ) is a U.S. state located  on  the Atlantic Coast in the Mid-Atlantic region of  the  United  राज्य  .
It is bordered  to  the south and west by Maryland , to the northeast by New Jersey , and to the north by Pennsylvania .
The state takes its name from Thomas West , 3rd Baron De La Warr , an English nobleman and Virginia 's first colonial governor ,  बाद  whom what is now  पुकारा   केप  Henlopen was originally named .
Delaware is located in the northeastern  portion  of the Delmarva  प्रायद्वीप   और  is the second smallest , the sixth least populous , but the sixth most  densely  populated  of  the fifty United  राज्य  .
Delaware is divided into three counties .
From  उत्तर  to south , these  तीन  counties are New Castle  ,  Kent , and  ससेक्स  .
While  the  southern two counties have historically been predominantly agricultural , New Castle  काउंटी   रै  been more industrialized .
Before its coastline was explored by Europeans in the  16th  century , Delaware was inhabited by several groups of Native Americans , including the Lenape in  the  north and  nanticoke   in  the  दक्षिण  .
It was  initially  colonized by Dutch traders  at  Zwaanendael , located near the present town  of  Lewes ,  in  1631 .
Delaware was one of the 13 colonies participating in the American  क्रान्ति  and on December 7  ,  1787 , became the  पहला   राज्य  to ratify  the  Constitution of the United States , thereby becoming known as The  पहला  State .
Energy Transformation in Energy Systems Language
Energy transformation or energy conversion is the process  of  changing one form of energy to another  .
In physics , the term energy describes the  क्षमता  to produce certain changes within a system , without regard to limitations in transformation imposed by Entropy .
Changes in total energy of systems can  तभी  be accomplished by  adding  or subtracting energy from them , as  उर्जा  is a quantity which  is  conserved , according to the first law of thermodynamics .
According to special relativity , changes in the  उर्जा  of systems will also coincide  साथ  changes in the  प्रणाली  's mass  ,  and the total amount of  द्रव्यमान  of a system is a measure of its energy .
उर्जा  in a  प्रणाली  may be transformed so  कि  it  resides  in a different state , or a different type of energy .
Energy in many states may be used to  do  many varieties of physical work .
Energy may  be  used in natural processes or machines , or else to provide some service to  समाज  ( such as heat , light , or motion  )   .
For example , an internal combustion engine converts  the  potential chemical energy in  गैसोलीन  and  ऑक्सीजन  into heat  ,   जिससे  is then transformed into  the  propulsive energy ( kinetic energy that moves a vehicle ) .
A solar cell converts solar radiation into electrical energy that can then be used to light a  बल्ब  or power a computer .
The generic name for a device which  converts   उर्जा  from one form to another , is a  ट्रान्सड्यूसर  .
In general , most types of energy , save for thermal energy , may be converted efficiently to any other kind of energy .
Sometimes this occurs with an efficiency of essentially  100  % , such as when potential energy  is  converted to kinetic energy as an object falls in vacuum , or when it  orbits  nearer  or  farther  इससे  another object , in space .
Conversion of other types of energies to heat  may  also occurs with nearly perfect efficiency ( many types  of  friction do this  )  .
Exceptions for perfect  परिवर्तन  efficiency  (  even for isolated systems ) occur when energy has already been partly distributed among many available quantum states for a collection of particles , which are freely allowed to explore any state of momentum and position ( phase space ) .
In such circumstances , a measure  पुकारा  Entropy , or evening-out of energy distribution in such states , dictates that future states of the system must  be  of at  तनिक  equal evenness in energy distribution .
( There is no way , taking the universe as a whole , to collect energy into fewer states , once it has spread  to  them ) .
A  consequence  of this requirement  is  that there are limitations to the efficiency with which thermal  उर्जा  can  be   परिवर्तित  to other kinds  of   उर्जा   ,  since thermal energy in equilibrium at a given temperature already represents the maximal evening-out of energy between all possible states  .
Such energy is sometimes considered `` degraded energy , ''  क्युकी  it  is  not entirely usable .
The second law of thermodynamics  is  a way of stating that ,  लिये  this reason , thermal energy in a system may  be  converted to other kinds  of  energy with efficiencies  approaching  100 % , only  if  the entropy ( even-ness or disorder ) of the universe is increased by other means , to compensate for the decrease  in   एन्ट्रॉपी  associated with the disappearance of the thermal energy and its entropy content .
वरना  , only a part of thermal energy  may  be converted to other kinds of energy ( and  यूँ  , useful work ) , since the  शेष  of the heat must be reserved to be transferred to a thermal reservoir at  a  lower  तापमान  , in such  a  way that the increase  in  Entropy for this process  अधिक  than compensates for the entropy decrease associated with transformation of the rest of the heat into other types of energy .
The National Hockey League ( NHL ; ) is  an  `` unincorporated not-for-profit association '' which operates a major professional ice hockey league  of  30  franchised  member clubs , of which seven  हैं  currently located in Canada and 23 in the United States  .
Headquartered  in   नई  York City , the NHL  is  widely considered to be the premier professional ice hockey  लीग  in the world , and one of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada  .
The Stanley Cup  ,  the oldest professional sports trophy in North America , is awarded annually to the league playoff champion at the end of each season .
The  लीग  was organized on November 26 , 1917 , in Montreal , Quebec , Canada , after the suspension of operations of its predecessor organization , the  नेशनल  Hockey Association ( NHA ) ,  जिससे  had been founded in 1909 .
It  प्रारंभ  with four teams and , through  a  series  of  expansions , contractions , and relocations , the league is now composed of 30 active franchises .
The nation to which the name of the league originally referred was Canada ,  हालांकि  the league has now been binational since 1924  जब  it expanded into the United States .
After a labour dispute that  led  to the cancellation of the entire  2004–05  season , the league resumed play under a  नई  collective bargaining agreement that included a  सैलरी  cap .
In 2009 , the NHL enjoyed record highs in  शर्तें  of sponsorships , attendance , and television audiences  .
The NHL draws many  अत्यधिक   skilled  players from all over  the  world and currently has players from  परिचय  20 different countries .
Although Canadians have historically constituted the majority of the players in the NHL ,  over  the past four plus decades the percentages of  us  and European  खिलाड़ी  have increased both because of the NHL 's continued  विस्तार  from six to thirty  क्लब  since 1967 , and the  increased  availability of highly skilled European players .
This is the  पूरा  list  of  the ratified and unratified amendments to the United States Constitution  जिससे   प्राप्त  the approval of the United States Congress  .
Twenty-seven amendments have been ratified  चूंकि  the  असली  signing of the Constitution , the first ten of  जिससे  are known collectively as the Bill  of  Rights .
The procedure for amending the United States Constitution is governed by Article  v  of the original text .
There  have  been many  अन्य  proposals for amendments to the United  राज्य  Constitution introduced in  कॉंग्रेस  , but not submitted to the states .
Before an  amendment  can take effect , it must be proposed to the states by a two-thirds vote of both houses of Congress  or  by a convention ( known as an  आलेख  V convention ) called by two-thirds of the states  ,  and ratified by three-fourths of the states  or   by  three-fourths of conventions thereof , the method  of  ratification being determined by Congress at the time of proposal .
To date ,  no  convention for proposing amendments has been called by the states , and only once—in 1933 for the ratification of the  twenty-first  amendment —has the convention method  of  ratification been employed .
FMR LLC ( Fidelity Management and Research )  or   वफ़ादारी  Investments is an American multinational financial  सेवाएं  corporation  .
It is one of the largest mutual fund and financial services groups in the world  .
It was founded  in   1946  and serves North  अमरीकी  investors .
Fidelity Ventures is its venture capital arm .
Fidelity International Limited ( FIL ) , was an international affiliate founded in 1969 , serving most countries in the rest of the world .
In September 2011 , FIL was rebranded as 'Fidelity Worldwide Investment '  .
Fidelity Investments manages a large family of mutual funds  ,  provides fund distribution and investment advice services , as well as providing discount  brokerage  services , retirement services , wealth  प्रबन्धन  , securities execution  और   क्लीयरेंस  , life insurance and a number of other services .
